these validators. Available evidence shows that these validators cross
existing diagnostic boundaries but tend to congregate more frequently
within and across adjacent DSM-5 chapter groups. Until incontrovert-
ible etiological or pathophysiological mechanisms are identified to fully
validate specific disorders or disorder spectra, the most important stan-

assessment of clinical course and treatment response of individuals
grouped by a given set of diagnostic criteria.
